attributes.action: Make Work Related Stress  absence over 7 days reportable under RIDDOR 2013
attributes.background: Work related stress is the most reported injury between workers. I would love to see all absence for work related stress reported to the HSE under the Reporting of Injuries,Diseases and Dangerous Occurrences Regulation 2013. Make stress an occupational disease, make stress RIDDOR 2013 reportable
attributes.additional_details: 12.5 million working days lost due to work - related stress, depression or anxiety in 2016/17 sourced information from HSE....so much productivity lost

attributes.action: Ban British citizens from serving in the Israeli military
attributes.background: There are currently many British citizens serving in the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF). The UK government should ban UK citizens – even if they hold other passports – from joining and serving in the Israeli military, police or other security forces.
attributes.additional_details: The Israeli military routinely commits acts which many experts believe, under international law, constitute war crimes - including occupying Palestinian territory; torturing suspects; bombing Palestinian schools, hospitals, and water plants; and conducting collective punishments of civilians - all of which are unlawful in international law. No UK citizens should be allowed to possibly contribute to further war crimes by serving in the Israeli military, police or security apparatus.

attributes.action: Provide short term emergency parking stickers for IBD sufferers.
attributes.background: I’m trying to be a voice for sufferers of Crohn’s and Colitis which are the two forms of inflammatory bowel disease. One of the main symptoms is an urgent need to use the toilet which, due to general poor accessibility to public toilets can often results in unnecessary incontinence.

attributes.action: Specialist provision for children/adults with Foetal Alcohol Spetrum Disorder
attributes.background: There are thousands of children in the UK who have been diagnosed with Foetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder. Most are being failed by the NHS system, as there are no specialist FASD teams providing proper care.  Many don't fulfil criteria for CAMHS/Paediatric services so have no ongoing care in place.
attributes.additional_details: FASD is a hidden disability that leaves children & young people vulnerable.  The NHS are frequently at a loss to know how to support this condition, with many children & parents left to fend for themselves.  Holistic specialised team for FASD families are needed, with specialised interest in working together to provide therapies and behavioural plans, including psychology, OT, sleep, medical, SALT, trauma, attachment & neurobehavioral (on the lines of Nate Sheets in Oregan).

attributes.action: Stop Ticket Touting and selling tickets above face value
attributes.background:
Ticket touting has to stop. Real fans are waiting an hour early to buy tickets only to be disappointed when all tickets are gone almost instantly. 

Ticket touts are using bots to buy a number of tickets only to sell them for 5x the amount on reseller sites such as Get Me In and StubHub.
attributes.additional_details:
I understand some people cannot make it to the gig and need to sell their tickets but in that case, they do not need to sell above face value. Touts should not be able to sell above face value + any transaction fees. 

To stop this, these reseller sites should be forced by law to only allow tickets to be sold at face value + any transaction fees and then add a small fee so that the site is still profitable. There is no reason for people to be selling tickets above face value even if they cannot attend an event.

Let's get this to parliament and force them to listen. Let's eliminate ticket touts from the industry and let real fans attend gigs again.

attributes.action: Reinstate sailing and windsurfing to A level and GCSE PE
attributes.background: Recently sailing and windsurfing have been taken off the list of sports you can be marked on for GCSE and A level PE. Some people started this course unaware of this change.
attributes.additional_details: Sailing and Windsurfing should be reinstated as you have to be physically fit to compete, you can race and it involves refining technique to do well. The UK is an island which mean there are plenty of places for young people to participate in these activities.

attributes.action: Make the maximum wait for CAMHS assesments no more than 6 months.
attributes.background:
Currently the wait to get a child assesed for autism is almost 1.5 years
This is not acceptable and can have serious implications on the child's mental health, as well as causing serious problems within the home. This petition is to try and persuade the government to reduce these waiting times.
attributes.additional_details: Waiting times are taken from friends currently on the waiting list in Warwickshire.

attributes.action: Illegal dog fighting - raise the period of imprisonment.
attributes.background: Although illegal, dog fighting and baiting; using dogs and cats is still going on.The maximum sentence for offenders is six months in prison and/or an unlimited fine, but campaigners want it to be raised to up to 3 years.
attributes.additional_details: The Animal Welfare Act 2006  has introduced an important and new concept for pet owners and those responsible for domestic animals. Dog fighting is still going on and proactive action needs to be taken to prevent such crimes, not just reactive action often when animals have been so cruelly killed.

attributes.action: Petition to Establish Evidence-Based Treatment for Eating Disorders in U.K.
attributes.background: Eating Disorders have the highest mortality rate of any psychiatric illness, yet in practice, therapy protocols do not reflect evidence-based care as recommended by the National Institute for Care Excellence (NICE).

attributes.action: Ban or reduce the excessive brightness of LED or HID high intensity car lights
attributes.background:
Car head lights are now so bright that it's hard to see driving in the dark because you get blinded by the oncoming cars with high intensity discharge (hid) or led driving lights.
The law needs to be changed to greatly reduce the brightness.

attributes.action: Mandatory training in ALL aspects of Domestic abuse for Family courts & Cafcass.
attributes.background:
Judiciary, Cafcass & Family court to be fully trained in domestic abuse, gas lighting, coercive control, stalking, sexual abuse, financial abuse, emotional abuse, harassment and its effects on the Family. 
70-90% of Family court & Cafcass cases involve DA.
Training would enable informed decisions
attributes.additional_details:
Daily decisions are made on recommendations by Cafcass for contact with perpetrators enforced by courts affecting families.

15 children were murdered in 2015 during contact that was enforced.

Training is essential for the safeguarding of all children and survivors.

http://safelives.org.uk/sites/default/files/resources/SafeLives%20Annual%20Impact%20Report%202016-17_web.pdf

https://www.naccc.org.uk/downloads/NewsItems/APPG_Inquiry_report_Domestic_Abuse_Child_Contact_and_the_Family_Court.pdf

attributes.action: Extend the review of PIP claims to all claims & the PIP decision making process
attributes.background:
This week a review of PIP Claims was announced in response to a High Court ruling that the clause 'for reasons other than psychological distress' into the Mobility Component was 'blatant discrimination'.
But, my experience is that the entire system needs review - individual decisions & the process
attributes.additional_details:
While I applaud the decision that claims will be reviewed following the High Court ruling, the flaws in the PIP system go further than the in-built discrimination against Mental Health Disabilities.
My experience is that those with Physical and Learning Disabilities are also discriminated against, & subject to flawed decisions.
The fact that over 65% of PIP decisions are overturned at Tribunal in favour of the Claimant demonstrates this clearly.
PIP needs to be reviewed in its entirety.

attributes.action: Prohibit the removal of trees/shrubs from riverbanks & in-river wildlife habitat
attributes.background: Vital wildlife habitat for protected species like otters bats & water voles is regularly destroyed plus nesting sites for birds & refuges for fish from predation.This is carried out without the threat of prosecution. Such actions must be licensed & subject to full environmental impact assessments.
attributes.additional_details: The Angling Trust has highlighted many situations where important habitat has been removed and even on occasion found evidence of the EA removing habitat that they themselves had helped to install. Landowners and the EA need clear incentives to manage riverine environments for the maximum benefit of wildlife.  Modern flood defense strategies have failed to look at the impact on river habitat removal and the wildlife that depends on it for its survival.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of White poppies alongside the British Legion red poppy campaign.
attributes.background: Ban the sale of white poppies in November, alongside the RBL Campaign as it is nothing more than a political move that detracts from the good work the legion do and make a mockery of the official remembrance campaign and those that gave their lives for this country.
attributes.additional_details: The white poppy campaign states that it remembers all war dead, which would include civilians and enemy combatants. Not just the enemy of old, but also the despicable fighters from groups like ISIL, who advocate rape and torture. While there is no issue with remembering more than just British Forces personnel who have given their lives, there is a great issue with doing this alongside the official campaign. The white poppy should only be sold at other times of the year.

attributes.action: Aesthetic medicine treatments only to be performed by Doctors, Nurses & Dentists
attributes.background: Everyday we are hearing horror stories involving inexperienced and unqualified people administering medical treatments such as botox, derma fillers etc. There is a need to regulate the aesthetic medicine industry finally.

attributes.action: Save the NHS - Stop the underfunding and skill shortages
attributes.background: We the undersigned believe current Government policy is creating a crisis in the NHS, which is the countries most valued institution.
attributes.additional_details: We demand HM Government implements the following 5 steps to save the NHS. a) Add all NHS job roles to the Shortage Occupation list to ensure full staffing. b) Cease all future outsourcing of core functionality to 3rd parties. c) Increase the pitiful recent settlement to the full £350m per week promised in the referendum. d) If increase funding is not readily available stop brexit and spend that wasted money on the NHS instead. e) Introduce Legislation to exclude any foreign government or companies involvement in the NHS, especially as part of any post Brexit trade deal.

attributes.action: Make it law that dog wardens must check lost Pet chips and inform owners at once
attributes.background: There are many cases of people phoning kennels about lost dogs to be told that the warden has not collected the dog it’s not there, then receiving a letter on the 6th day of it being there telling them to collect it, this isn't right the dog only has 7 days before council take ownership  PTS rehomed
attributes.additional_details: There are two cases that I'm aware of where dogs have been PTS before the owner had chance to rescue they had not been informed by dog warden/kennels even after ringing up and asking cases where owners have been looking for their dogs and they've been rehomed starting a debate about ownership and the original owners having to say goodbye to their best friend because they cant afford to fight in court People are turning to social media and volunteers to find and return dogs because its safer.

attributes.action: Allow Scotland to host a second referendum for Scottish Independence.
attributes.background: During the first referendum the Scottish public were presented with a number of promises from the Westminster government in the case of a No vote. These promises have since either been broken or forgotten. As a direct result we the undersigned demand a second referendum on independence.
attributes.additional_details:
Broken Promises.
.We were told we would remain in the EU - Despite voting to stay we're leaving. 
.Extensive new powers for the Scottish Parliament - Westminster wishes to now strip powers from Scotland.
.Continuation of the Barnett Formula - There are now talks of cutting Scotland's budget further.
.Work was promised for the shipyards - The amount promised has since decreased and possibly relocated also. 
.Public Sector Jobs
.Social Security
.Renewables
All promised. Non delivered.

attributes.action: Make ocrelizumab available on the NHS for multiple sclerosis patients
attributes.background: Ocrelizumab is the first treatment for primary progressive MS sufferers and it's been classed a game changer for relapsing remitting MS. More than 100,000 people suffer with this horrific disease in the U.K, it's a daily struggle living with a range of complexed symptoms.

attributes.action: Urge the FCA to cap repayments on rent-to-own and doorstep lending
attributes.background: The Sun is calling for a cap on the total cost of rent-to-own loans and doorstep lending at double the original item price or loan amount. This was introduced for payday loans in 2015 and the numbers of people struggling with unmanageable debts to those lenders has more than halved.
attributes.additional_details:
People on the lowest incomes, living in the poorest places, are paying a poverty premium - around 7 million people have resorted to high-cost credit. People whose wages or benefits don't stretch far enough need to borrow from rent-to-own or doorstep lenders to help pay for things such as an unexpected bill or to furnish their homes. These come with exorbitant rates of interest - more than 1,500% in some cases of doorstep lending. 
It's time to stop the credit rip-off.

attributes.action: Abolish the killing of stray animals in Council shelters!
attributes.background: Currently it is legal for Council shelters to destroy stray dogs, cats etc. in 7 days if they are not reclaimed or taken in by a rescue such as Dog's Trust, Cats Protection or another animal charity!
attributes.additional_details: I would like the Government to abolish the killing of animals in Council shelters, turn them into People's Rescues and afford them charity status, so as the public can keep these animals alive via contributions!

attributes.action: Introduce MPs to represent the interests of British citizens living abroad.
attributes.background:
There are over five million British citizens living abroad. Their only recourse for representation in the UK is through their 'constituency' MP. 

This is not only unfair to constituency residents but citizens abroad who have legitimate concerns and issues which should be considered together.
attributes.additional_details:
It's not fair to any party that the vote and interests of someone in Spain carry the same priority as someone living in Edinburgh. This introduction will remedy a profound democratic deficit and also allow constituency MPs to focus exclusively on the issues of their area. 

There are already examples of this system working well - France and Macedonia have representatives for their overseas citizens.

attributes.action: Pressure Donald Trump to not move the US embassy for Israel to Jerusalem.
attributes.background: The international community doesn't recognise Israel's right over the city. Other religious groups also have legitimate claims to Jerusalem. Trump's intention to move the US embassy should be condemned by the UK government.

attributes.action: Make independent inventory reporting of privately rented properties compulsory
attributes.background:
Independent inventory reporting of privately rented properties on an AST should be a mandatory requirement.

Independent inventories offer protection and help to reduce the number of deposit disputes.

Please support this petition and help us make the letting process more transparent for all.
attributes.additional_details:
As the Private Rented Sector now covers a fifth of all households (EHS 2015-16), it’s crucial that tenants and landlords abide by a fair move-in/move-out process.

Key figures:

- A third of 2,500 tenants admitted having their deposit withheld and 68% believed their landlord didn’t provide good enough reason to do so (Hillarys, 2017).

- 40% of students lose well over a third of their deposit when they rent privately, while 79% do not sign a photo inventory when they move in (Money.co.uk, 2016).

attributes.action: The government must ring-fence mental health budgets.
attributes.background:
Mental health staff numbers are not increasing at anything like the rate the government claims. The government announced additional funding for mental health, but not all the money pledged is reaching the front line. The government must agree to ring-fence mental health budgets.

.
attributes.additional_details:
Two years ago, the government announced additional funding for mental health - £1.4 billion over five years to deliver the Five Year Forward View for Mental Health and £1.25 billion for the Future In Mind programme for Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services. 
We know however that not all the money pledged is reaching the front line. Too many Clinical Commissioning Groups – the bodies that decide how money is spent locally – are using the money for other services.
#mentalhealthmatters

attributes.action: Take back control of MP salaries, reduce MP pay to UK average salary (£27k pa)
attributes.background: Take back control from IPSA and implement a new pay structure method which determines MP salaries by analysing all UK salaries and sets MP salaries at the same level as the average UK salary, which is currently around £27,000 pa (2017).
attributes.additional_details:
Travel expenses to and from work engagements should be either refunded to the MP - or - MPs should be given free travel-cards to enable them to travel to and from work engagements free from financial expense.

This isn't about punishing MPs, it's about restructuring MP salaries to better reflect the values we hold dear in Britain; values of fairness and equality. In times of financial difficulty for many citizens in the UK, we need to make changes in the government that align with reality.

attributes.action: Allow Students Who Are Estranged From Family To Claim Housing Benefit In Summer
attributes.background: Students are not permitted to access Housing Benefit. But 'estranged students', whose relationship with their parents has broken down, and who are not leaving care, are not given any financial maintenance for the 10-week summer break. Thousands of students face homelessness over summer as a result.
attributes.additional_details: Student maintenance loans are calculated to cover the costs of studying during term time, assuming a level of family support over the holidays. In England And Wales, there are around 9,000 estranged students, who don’t have parental support and who aren’t care leavers. Research shows these students struggle with homelessness over the summer break. The government should lift restrictions, allowing students without parental or local authority support to receive housing benefit over summer.

attributes.action: Increase School Funding to local authorities and Stop the Education Cuts.
attributes.background: Over the last two years schools have been forced to reduce the number of school support staff owing to unprecedented cuts in the Government support grant.Those taking the hardest cuts are school support staff who are either made redundant or have to do more by having extra duties without recognition
attributes.additional_details:
Schools should have more than the current funding settlement and the freedom to employ the right level of support staff appropriate to the needs of their pupils with the drive to improve education standards.
They are the backbone of our education system and should be treated with respect. They help the most vulnerable children and schools cannot function without them. As a consequence, many children would struggle and leave school without the qualifications and skills needed in adulthood.

attributes.action: Government must publish a Carers' Strategy and not a Carers’ Action Plan
attributes.background: I am one of the 7 million unpaid carers in the country. You can read about me here http://bit.ly/2lGLpxc (Guardian web link) I took part in a government consultation for unpaid carers in early 2016. Carers have been waiting for a Government Strategy ever since.  I know unpaid carers deserve better.
attributes.additional_details: Like 6,500 other carers, I spent time providing evidence for government on our caring role. It was expected that government would publish the results in a Carers Strategy by the end of 2016. Nothing has happened since the consultation closed. In October 2017, I was quoted in a debate in Parliament https://goo.gl/vN27L2 (Parliament web link). An Action Plan was recently mentioned but an Action Plan is not a Carers' Strategy. Signing this petition will show government that carers matter.

attributes.action: Make scoliosis screening compulsory in all UK schools
attributes.background: It is estimated 4 out of every 1000 children in the UK have scoliosis.  Once a curve reaches 40 degrees, spinal fusion surgery is the only option for treatment. Introducing a screening program into schools would reduce the number of patients undergoing major, invasive, life changing surgery.
attributes.additional_details: Around half of US States have compulsory screening in schools, the program is FREE other than a small cost to train a member of staff to be able to carry out the basic "Forward Bend" test. This is a simple solution to a massive, and growing, problem in our society. By catching scoliosis early, the options for treatment is wider and the life of the affected child would be less impacted. The overall cost on the NHS would be lower as each operation for the surgery alone costs in excess of £10,000.

attributes.action: Give kinship carers and other close family the same right as foster carers.
attributes.background: Thousands of family members - aunts, uncles, grandparents, etc. take children in rather than have them go into state care, easing the pressure on the social services system. Yet unlike foster carers kinship carers are unpaid, not entitled to any leave, or assistance in providing for these children.
attributes.additional_details: In a 2011 a study was carried out by the University of Bristol which highlighted that there were over 152,910 children in kinship care in England, in Scotland it was 12,630, in Wales it was 9,560, and in Northern Ireland it was 4,940. The study is now more than 6 years out of date so these totals may have increase vastly, yet still kinship carers are not entitled to the same support that parents and foster carers take for granted.

attributes.action: Continue to fund the ICS (international citizen service) programme.
attributes.background: The Department for International Development is currently reviewing the ICS programme. ICS supports young people to gain experience in working in other countries to raising awareness of important issues, they do this by public speaking , teaching and building. This supports YP for their future!

attributes.action: Make ‘trade unionism’ a protected characteristic under the Equality Act 2010.
attributes.background: The Equality Act brings previous discrimination legislation under one act.  Its main aim is to make it unlawful for employers to treat a worker less favourably because of a protected characteristic such as sex, race, religion or belief.  Trade unionism is not currently a protected characteristic.
attributes.additional_details: We call on the Equality Act 2010 to include “Trade Unionism: the participation in all or any aspects of the system, practices, and beliefs of trade unions, including the participation in lawful industrial action and activities stemming from such action’. Such a change would provide clarity in the workplace and a clear instruction to employers that they will no longer be able to subvert universal principles of democracy, justice and human rights through legislative loopholes.

attributes.action: Fund Slow Down For Horses and Horse Awareness Adverts on Television
attributes.background: We see adverts warning drivers of the dangers of speeding. A horse is a live animal, unpredictable in most surroundings and traffic. We need adverts to highlight this with stories and evidence to hit home. Horse riding has become more popular which is resulting in more accidents and even deaths.

attributes.action:
Stop incineration of any waste which could be recycled. 
No new incinerators!
attributes.background: Incinerators are fuelled with domestic and commercial rubbish that has not had everything recyclable or biodegradable taken out e.g. food waste and plastics. We want 1. Legislation to stop waste of material resources. 2. Waste reduction, reuse and recycling to be made absolute top priority in law.
attributes.additional_details:
Incinerators (known as gasification, pyrolysis, EfW, ATT or ACT plants) produce air pollutants. These are a concern for public health: https://laqm.defra.gov.uk/assets/63091defraairqualityguide9web.pdf

A cross party Early Day motion signed by 19 MPs calls for a moratorium on incineration: https://www.parliament.uk/edm/2017-19/581

We ask that p.94 of this plan be put into law:    https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/673203/25-year-environment-plan.pdf):

attributes.action: Strobe Light Warnings to be a Legal Requirement
attributes.background: For establishments using strobe lights, or for companies utilising a building in which they will issue strobe lights, there should be a legal requirement for both parties to issue a strobe light warning on both the physical establishment and on the respective website clearly.

attributes.action: Amend the Wildlife Act so companies have to protect wildlife
attributes.background: There's nothing in the Wildlife Act which states that companies must put measures in place to prevent wildlife from being injured/killed whilst they are undertaking outdoor work. We want the Wildlife Act amended in order to reduce the number of animals going to rescues due to the work of businesses.
attributes.additional_details: The Wildlife Act needs to be updated in order to protect all wildlife. Companies have to take responsibility for their actions towards wildlife, for example, putting ramps down holes, covering up all holes, paying the bills of the animals they have injured and so on. By putting this in place, it will help reduce the number of injured or killed wild animals.

attributes.action: Please do not increase the IHS paid by migrants coming to the UK to £400
attributes.background:
We are asking Parliament to please consider the real impact this increase is going to have on families of British Citizens who are already struggling to pay for visas fees.
This increase will cause more broken families.
attributes.additional_details:
The IHS fee is paid on top of visa application fees, which are already extremely expensive. Such fees have thousands of families broken around the world because the British Citizen simply cannot afford to pay the cost of bringing his/her family to the UK.
Currently, immigrants pay £200 per year as an Immigration Health Surcharge (IHS) to contribute towards the cost of running the NHS. The government has announced that this fee will increase to £400 per year.

attributes.action: Introduce an Electronic Voting System to stop Voting Fraud
attributes.background: Voting Fraud is happening in the UK
attributes.additional_details:
The people of the UK request that before the next General Election a new voting procedure be put into place.     The system should  have the ability to stamp out voter fraud and should be able to check for multiple voting  which is happening  in some areas of the UK.      Some form of electronic voting using your  National Insurance number or even the issuing an identify card would be ideal.  

Postal voting should only be available to the elderly and severely disabled.    

Penalties for illegal voting and multiple voting should be severe and classed as a criminal conviction, a £5,000 fine, and a ban from voting for at least 10 years.

The voting system should apply to the whole of the UK.... no exceptions

attributes.action: Lower the age a stillborn can legally be registered.
attributes.background: It should be the parents’ choice whether to have a birth certificate. All stillborn babies should be able to be registered if that’s what the parents want. I ask as many people as possible to sign this petition, email your MPs and raise awareness so these babies get recognition.
attributes.additional_details:
We were given the devastating news at 16 weeks that our baby girl will not survive after birth, and there is nothing we can do to save her. Nothing. I am going to lose my Little Bean.
 
We were offered a termination, but then told our little girl will never legally exist. I have chosen to carry my baby girl until 24 weeks so she gets the recognition she deserves. Every day I feel her kick and grow, knowing I am one day closer to saying goodbye. 8 long weeks.
 
It is torture, its heart breaking.

attributes.action: Introduce minimum sentencing for child sexual abuse and online grooming
attributes.background:
We call for 'minimum' sentences and 'open ended' sentencing guidelines to be introduced for child sexual abuse and the offence's related to online child 'grooming'.

We also call for the introduction of laws that keep serial child abusers who re-offend in prison 'indefinitely'.
attributes.additional_details:
We call on the Ministry of Justice to review and reform sentencing laws and guidelines for crimes of child sexual abuse and in particular online grooming of children, and the introduction of 'minimum' sentences. 

Sentencing needs to be appropriate and in accordance with the severity of the crime of sexual grooming of children. Current sentencing guidelines must be reviewed in order to seek justice and to protect the rights of the innocent.

attributes.action: The option for farm animal sanctuaries to replace ear tags with microchips
attributes.background: Identification ear tags on farm animals for me and many others are a constant reminder of what certain animals are bred for and where they have come from. I have a farm animal sanctuary and all of our animals will be living the rest of their lives at the sanctuary, so ear tags are not necessary.
attributes.additional_details:
Farm animals that are in a sanctuary environment, that will never be entering the food chain nor being rehomed I don't believe need to have ear tags nor slap marks or tattoos for pigs. 
I believe that ear tags are pointless in a sanctuary, they must be extremely annoying, they can get infected, tags are caught and pulled out. I understand the government want a tractability system in place but microchipping will allow all the information that is needed to be on the microchip.

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for cystic fibrosis sufferers
attributes.background: Cystic Fibrosis in an incurable condition prodomanantly affecting patients lungs and pancreas, with sufferers often on more then 40 pills a day. CF doesn’t get free prescriptions because when they were introduced sufferers died before 16 but now with better life expectancy they need free medicine .

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory fluoridation of the water supply to prevent tooth decay
attributes.background: Tooth decay is almost entirely preventable, but is the most common reason why children aged 5 to 9 require hospital admission. Water fluoridation is an effective public health measure proven to reduce tooth decay. Centrally funded and mandated water fluoridation is needed to protect our oral health.
attributes.additional_details:
PHE recommends fluoridation, but cannot enforce it. It's within the remit of local authorities, many of which do not have funds to implement it. 31 to 41% of 5-year-old children have evidence of tooth decay, with higher rates in deprived populations. 

PHE research reveals:

- 15% fewer 5-year-olds with tooth decay in fluoridated areas, rising to 28% when deprivation is considered
- 45% fewer hospital admissions of children aged 1 to 4 for tooth decay in fluoridated areas

attributes.action: Halt the cuts to military music.
attributes.background:
The Royal Marines, Army and Central Band of the Royal Air Force are an integral part of the the British Military.
If the cuts to military music are not halted national ceremonies such as Armistice Day will suffer removing the infrastructure and teaching process.  No further cuts to military music.
attributes.additional_details:
Bands have had a secondary role for some twenty years being trained as Medics. This was not some haphazard scheme but properly conducted by the RAMC Training school in Ash Vale and was as stringent and complex as the training given to their own trainees.

Bands did go on operations and supplied medical cover.

The scrapping of all Regimental Bands was a catastrophe and what remains of Military Music must be left in place.   

No further cuts to military music.

attributes.action: Halt immediately UK arms sales to Turkey until they withdraw from Afrin Syria.
attributes.background:
Turkish aggression against the Kurds of Afrin is in breach of the UN charter and the UKs signitor responsibility to uphold the Charter.
It is acknowledged the vital support Kurdish Forces have given, in the fight against IS to the UK.A just settlement for the Kurds is a requirement of peace

attributes.action: Request the UK government in the Brexit negotiations to agree 4 specific points
attributes.background: The petition is to ask the UK Government to agree on the behalf of The British Electorate 4 specific points.
attributes.additional_details:
We the under signed, request the UK government in the Brexit negotiations to;
1). Pay the EU nothing more. 
2). On UK sovereign matters, the UK Courts to have final jurisdiction.
3). Northern Ireland to be solely a UK issue. 
4). Immigrant quotas at the sole discretion of UK Parliament, with no interference from the EU.

attributes.action: Commission a statue of Enoch Powell to be placed outside Parliament
attributes.background: In light of the contribution made to the UK by his actions in Parliament and in the Armed Forces we urge that a stature of Enoch Powell is commissioned and placed outside Parliament to honour his dedication to his country.

attributes.action: Stop plans to cut Cannon Street trains on the Hayes (Kent) train line
attributes.background: Following a government consultation on the future of south eastern rail services, the secretary for State for Transport is recommending that companies bidding for the south eastern train franchise should make their bid based on the proposed change to cut services to Cannon Street from 2022.
attributes.additional_details: The Hayes line would in future run to London Bridge, Charing Cross and Victoria. The paper states that the ‘ small number of passengers who currently travel to Cannon Street, would need to change at London Bridge’.  The trains to Cannon Street are already extremely busy with no seats available by the time the trains reach Catford. Cutting the services would have a huge impact on local commuters, not only increasing their travel time but also further overcrowding at London Bridge.

attributes.action: To upgrade all English bridleways to byways.
attributes.background:
Opening up England’s bridleways would have a fantastic impact on the UKs health and pump more money into the UK economy. 
This change is mainly aimed for the trail riding community, estimated at 10,000 people.
attributes.additional_details:
A recent study in the European Journal of Applied Physiology demonstrated that riding a motorcycle on unsurfaced roads two to four times a week reduced blood pressure and body fat. 
These changes reduce the risk of diabetes and cardiovascular disease. 
Research indicates that riders spend an average of £5000 equipping themselves to take up trail riding, estimated 10,000 UK riders equates to £50 million. 
UK trail riders spend approximately £8.5 million per year on consumable items and insurance.
